Package tmp

Class Merchant

  • java.lang.Object
    • tmp.Merchant
  • public class Merchant
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    01/31/2019 Merchants travel from Port to Port, trading Commodities. Their goal is to make as much profit as possible before returning home.
    Author:
    Michael Bianconi

    • Field Summary

        home - ID of the Merchant's Home Port.
        current - ID of the Merchant's Current Port.
        capacity - How much weight the Merchant can hold.

      • retrieveAll

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​Merchant> retrieveAll​(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Retrieves ALL Merchants from the table and stores them in a HashMap.
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection to the database.
        Returns:
        Returns a Map linking each MerchantID to its Merchant.

      • store

        public boolean store​(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Stores this Merchant into the database. Will replace the old one if one already exists with the same ID.
        Parameters:
        conn - The connection to the database.
        Returns:
        True if and only if successful.

      • getLatestVoyage

        public Voyage getLatestVoyage​(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection to the database.
        Returns:
        Returns this Merchant's most recent Voyage (the voyage with the largest timestamp).

      • canTrade

        public boolean canTrade​(Port port,
                        Commodity com,
                        int amount,
                        java.sql.Connection conn)
        Runs through the necessary conditions for trading a commodity with a port. They must have enough available, they must have enough Gold, and the Merchant must, if buying, have enough capacity to carry the new Commodities.
        Parameters:
        port - Port to trade with.
        com - Commodity to trade.
        amount - Amount to trade (- for selling, + for buying).
        conn - Connection to the database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if able to trade.

      • canTravel

        public boolean canTravel​(Route r,
                         java.sql.Connection conn)
        To travel along a Route, the Merchant must currently be at the starting port and must own the required commodities.
        Parameters:
        r - Route to travel.
        conn - Connection to the database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Merchant can use the Route.
